msItem.title: I. Gädlä Libanos “Vita of Libanos”
msItem.incipit: Fol. 3ra: በስመ”... በስመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ ዘእምቅድመ፡ ዓለም፡ ህላዌሁ፨ ወእስከ፡ ለዓለም፡ ዘኢየሐልቅ፡ ምስፍናሁ፨ ልዑል፡ በልዕልናሁ፨ ስቡሕ፡ በስብሐቲሁ፨ ለወልድ፡ ብርሃን፡ ከማሁ፨ ወለመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፀዳሉ፡ ወሱራሄሁ፤ በከመ፤ ይቤሉ፡ ነቢያቲሁ፤ ንርአይ፡ ብርሃነ፡ በብርሃነ፡ ዚአሁ። ወይቤሉ፡ ንርአይ፣ ብርሃነ፡ በብርሃናቲሁ፨ ...Fol. 3ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. One God. In the name of the Lord, the Father, Whose essence is from before the world, and His lordship will not cease in the world. Most High in the height, glorious in the glory of the Son, as the light, and splendour and glory of the Holy Spirit. As His prophets said: “Let us look at the light in His light”. And they said “Let us look at the light in His lights. ...
msItem.explicit: Fol. 56ra, l.1: ... ወሶበ፤ ፈጸመ፡ ንጉሥነ፤ ገብረ፡ መስቀል፨ አውጽአ፡ ደመ፡ እምእንግድዓሁ፡ ወወደየ፡ ውስተ፡ መቃብሪሁ፡ ለአቡነ፨ ወይቤ፡ ሥጋየ፡ ምስለ፡ ሥጋከ፡ ወነፍስየ፡ ምስለ፡ ነፍስከ፨ ከመ፡ ትደምረኒ፡ ምስሌከ፡ በምንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ እስከ፡ ለዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ፨Fol. 56ra, l.1: ... And when our king Gäbrä Mäsqä finished, he expelled the bloud from his chest and put (it) in the graves of the ʾabunä and he said: “My corpse (is) with your corpse and my soul with your soul so that you will associate me with you in the Kingdom of Haeven for ever. Amen.

fols. 110r-113v “Homily by Ēleyas, Bishop (of Axum), for the commemoration of Abbā Maṭaˤ or Libānos”
Asmara, Library of the Pavoni Social Center (1674)
Asmara, Library of the Pavoni Social Center (20th cent.)
fols. 5ra-22ra: “Gädlä Libanos, Vie de St. Libanos, présentée comme homélie de ce saint par Elyas, évêque d’Axoum”
fols. 2ra-20rb: “Gädlä Libanos. Vie d’abba Libanos, homélie par Elyas, évêque d’Axoum”
Conti Rossini (text copied from a ms. kept in Däbrä Libanos, Eritrea)

note.p: The text with the Vita of Libanos seems more closed to the text as in the so called second recension, but with some more passages in the prologue. For more details about this second recension cp. .Bausi, La «Vita» e i «miracoli» di Libānos, Lovanii 2003a (CSCO 595, 596 [SAe 105, 106]), 1-42 [text] and 1-31 [tr.].

msItem.title: II. Mälkǝʾa Libanos “Image of Libanos” (31 strophes)
msItem.incipit: Fol. 47r: ኦክርስቶስ፡ ዘተወለድከ፡ እምድንግል፡ መድኃኒተ፡ ነፍሶሙ፡ ትኩን፡ ለሕዝበ፡ ሙስና፡ ወኃጕል፨ ስብሐተ፡ ሊባኖስ፡ ገብርከ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወንጌል፨ ባርክ፡ በየማንከ፡ ወበእዴከ፡ መስቀል፨ አኮኑ፡ ለሊከ፡ ባርኮተ፡ ትክል፨ ሰላም፡ ለዝክረ፡ ስምከ፡ ዘተበፅዓ፡ ፈድፋደ፨...Fol. 47r: O Christ, you who were born from the Virgin, may you be the salvation of their souls, for the people of the corruption and of the perdition. Glory (be for) Libanos, Your servant, apostle of the Saint Gospel; bless with your right hand, while your left hand (holds) the Cross; is it not that you yourself can bless? Salutation to the remembrance of your name which was honoured abundantly...
msItem.explicit: Fol. 53v, ls. 1-6: ስብሐት፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ለፈጸሞ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ድርሳን፨ ዘጸገወኒ፡ ሥልጣነ፡ በዘዚአሁ፡ ሥልጣን፨ ባርከኒ፡ አባ፡ ለደቂቅከ፡ ኄራን፨ ነጺሮሙ፡ በረከትከ፡ ወሰሚዖሙ፡ በዕዝን፨ ቅዱሳን፡ መላእክት፡ ይበሉ፡ አሜን፨ Fol. 53v, ls. 1-6: Glory to the Lord, for the completion of this Homily, (the Lord) Who has granted me of his authority among his authority. Bless me, ʾabba, Your good Son. Having observed Your blessing and listed with the ear, let the saints angels say: “Amen”.

listBibl.bibl: Asmara, Library of the Pavoni Social Center (1674)
Asmara, Library of the Pavoni Social Center (20th cent.)

msItem.title: III. Sälam-hymn for Libanos
msItem.incipit: Fol. 53v, l.7: ሰላም፡ ሰላም፡ ሊባኖስ፡ ብፁዕ፨ መንነከ[sic]፡ ኃላፊ፡ ዘበምድር፡ ፍግዕ፨ ለወልደ፡ ድንግል፡ ዴገንኮ፡ ለበግዕ፨ ዘቢጠከ፡ ኰኵሐ፡ አውኃዝኮ፡ ለነቅዕ። በእንተ፡ ጽድቅ፡ ወሕይወት፡ ርእሶ፡ አንደየ፨ እምኃውዘ፡ ዓለም፡ ጐየ፨ እምኀበ፡ እግዚኡ፡ ተዓሥየ፡ ሠናየ፨...Fol. 53v, l.7: Salutation, salutation (to) Libanos the blessed. You have rejected what it is the temporary pleasure on the earth. You have hunted for the Son of the Virgin, the lamb. Having hit the rock, you have caused a spring flow out. For the sake of the righteousness and the life, he impoverished himself; he escaped from the delight of the world; he has been nicely rewarded from his Lord. ...
msItem.explicit: Fol. 54v, l.10: ... ሰላም፡ ለፀአተ፡ ነፍስከ፡ አመ፡ ሰሉሱ፡ ለጥር፤ ጊዜ፡ ፍና፡ ቀትር፤ ብፁዕ፡ ሊባኖስ፡ ጥዑመ፡ ዜና፡ ወዝክር፨ ወረዱ፡ ይትቀበሉከ፡ ግሩማነ፡ ራእይ፡ ማኅበር፡ እንዘ፡ ይዜምሩ፡ በሐዋዝ፡ መዝሙር፨Fol. 54v, l.10: ... Salutation to the departure of your soul on the 3rd of Ṭǝrr; in the time of noon, blessed Libanos, pleasant in story and remembrance. They descended to receive you, those of the awesome appearance, while singing a joyful hymn.

listBibl.bibl: EMML no. 2096 (17th cent., Monastery of Ḥayq ʾƎsṭifanos, ʾAmbassäl, Wällo)
EMML no. 2810 (18th cent., Private library of Mäggabi Ḫaylä Mikaʾel, Ḥayq, ʾAmbassäl, Wällo),

msItem.title: IV. Täʾamrä Libanos “Miracles of Libanos” (two miracles)
msItem.incipit: Fol. 56ra, l.14 (Miracle 1): ተአምሪሁ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ሊባኖስ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁሩ፡ ገብረ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ለዓ[fol. 56rb]ለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ወሀሎ፡ ፩፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘየብሰት፡ እዴሁ፨ ወበጽሐ፡ ኀበ፡ መካኑ፡ ለቅዱስ፤ ወተሳለመ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያኑ፡ ሖረ፡ ወተሐፅበ፡ እማየ፡ ሕይወት፨ ...Fol. 56ra, l.14 (Miracle 1): Miracles of ʾabunä Libanos. May his prayer and his blessing be with his beloved Gäbrä Krǝstos. Forever and ever. Amen. And there was a man whose hands were dry. And he arrived to the place of the saint and venerated his church, departed and he washed himself with the water of the life. ...
msItem.explicit: Fol. 57va, l.18 (Miracle 2): ... ወተናቀዋ፡ አዕፅምትየ፨ [fol. 57vb]ወረታእኩ፡ በከመ፡ ትሬእዩኒ፡ ይእዜ፡ ወኵሉ፡ ዘርእየ፡ ወሰምዓ፡ ሰብሖ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወአንከሩ፡ ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ሊባኖስ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁሩ፡ ገብረ፡ ክርስቶስ። ወምስለ፡ ኵልነ፡ ደቂቁ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ ፨ ፨ ፨ ፨Fol. 57va, l.18 (Miracle 2): ... and my bones cracked, and I became straight in the way you see me now”. And everybody who saw and heard glorified the Lord, and they were astonished (by the) miracles of St. Libanos. May his prayer and his blessing be with his beloved Gäbrä Krǝstos, and with each of us, his children. Forever and ever. Amen.

listBibl.bibl: Asmara, Library of the Pavoni Social Center (1674)
Asmara, Library of the Pavoni Social Center (20th cent.)
Conti Rossini (text copied from a ms. kept in Däbrä Libanos, Eritrea)

note.p: IV-1) Fols. 56ra (l.14) – 57ra (l.12): The healing of a man whose hands were paralyzed.
IV-2) Fols. 57ra (l.12) – 57vb: The healing of a man from the king's army, who was sick and bowed.

msItem.note: In some fols., one or two ruled lines in the bottom of the page were not used by the scribe, e.g., fols. 7r, 47r, 48r, 49r, 50rv, 51rv, 52rv (one), 54r (one), 53rv (two) 54r.
In fols. 30vb and 54v portions of the text are written below the ruling.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 58.0 folios, of which 3.0 blank fols. 1rv, 2rv, 58rv, in 7.0 quires (A + 6).
16.0 14.8 3.8

list.item:
8
VI (8; s.l.: 1, stub before 1; 8, stub after 8/fols. 43r-46v {fols. 47r-54v} 55r-58v).
Fols. 47r-54v of a smaller size are infixed in the middle of quire VI.

supportDesc.condition: Most of the fols. are damaged by water. The original sewing is for the most part not in place; quires and separate leaves are kept together by means of crude stitches with white threads

layout.note: Fols. 1r-46v, 55r-58v. All data are taken from fol. 4r.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.note: Fols. 47r-54v. All data are taken from fol. 47r.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: colon with dashes above and below (e.g., fols.: 3ra, ls. 11, 12; 3rb, l.6; 5rb, l.2; 12rb, l.1; 12va, l.10; 24rb, l.3);
colon with dash above (esp. fol. 3ra, l.14).
II. Four dot asterisk (e.g., fols.: 3va, ls. 1, 3, 5, 9; 44rb, ls. 2, 4, 8);
nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text);
doubled four dot asterisks (esp. fol. 57ra, ls. 9, 15);
doubled nine dot asterisks (esp. fols.: 12ra, l.1; 56ra, l.12);
two parallel dashes (esp. fols.: 49v, l.7; 50r, l.10; fol. 51v, l.5; 52r, l.12; 53v, l.13);
nine dot asterisks (esp. fols.: 12va, l.1; 57vb, l.13).
III. Chain of black and red dots (esp. fols.: 53v, l.6; 55ra, l.5; 56ra, l.13; 57ra, l.12; 57vb, l.13).

handDesc.handNote:
Mediocre. Black; red. ˤAśbä MaryamˤAśbä Maryam is mentioned as the scribe in the supplication formula in fol. 55ra, l.4.17th century (?).
ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ (e.g.: fols. 47v, l.5; 48v, ls.6, 11; 49v, ls. 4,10; 51r, l.2).

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (the front board is cracked and repaired); a piece of textile crudely sewn to the spine. Two pairs of sewing stations.

origin.origDate: 17th century (?). Fols. 47r-54v (quire VI) were added somewhat later, but the text has been written by the same scribe.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Gäbrä Krǝstos is mentioned as the commissioner in the supplication formula, fol. 55ra, l.2, and elsewhere, in the supplication formulas in Texts I and III (e.g., fols. 4rb, l.6; 7va, l.9; 33ra, ls. 10-11, etc.).

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
